section.p: After the required adaptations of your application are finished, you register your application as a technical service in .
There are two possibilities for achieving this task:

If the application does not provide any parameters, options, roles, events, or operations, register the application as a technical service using the user interface. Here, you can define the basic features for the technical service you want to provide.
If an application is more complex and provides parameters, options, etc., create an XML file containing the technical service definition and import this file into . The figure below provides an overview of the two possibilities:
Possibility 1 consists of registering the application and then updating the service definition. Possibility 2 consists of creating an XML file and importing this file into .
You can also combine both ways. For example:

ol.li: Register the service using the user interface.
Export the service definition and save it to an XML file.
Edit the XML file: Specify descriptions, license information, parameters, options, events, roles, operations, etc.
Import the XML file into again.

section.p: After registering your application as a technical service, you need to appoint suppliers for it in so that marketable services can be defined and published.
The following sections describe the individual steps in detail.
